definition: "water" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 85), occurring in 没, 法, 流 etc/see also 三點水|三点水[san1 dian3 shui3]
(of droplets, sparks etc) to fly about in all directions/to splatter everywhere

sentences.english: The little rain drop slipt from the umbrella to my glasses.
sentences.chinese: 從她傘骨滑下來的小雨點濺在我眼鏡玻璃上。

sentences.english: Buy stocks when there is bloodshed in the street.
sentences.chinese: 街頭濺血，就是買股票的時機。

sentences.english: The trousers were bespattered  with mud.
sentences.chinese: 褲子被濺起的污泥弄髒了。

sentences.english: Waves could be seen splashing into city streets and over bridges.
sentences.chinese: 可以看到波浪湧入城市街區，甚至是濺到橋上。

sentences.english: The floor was splattered with blood, and the ambassador's eyeglasses lay a few feet from his body.
sentences.chinese: 鮮血濺了一地，大使的眼鏡掉在他屍體的不遠處。

sentences.english: Or is it the plashing of tears?
sentences.chinese: 或者那是眼淚濺起的水花麼？

sentences.english: When it rained, funny sounds came from the splashing raindrop on the butterbur leaf.
sentences.chinese: 下雨了，雨點濺在款冬葉子上發出好聽的聲音。
每個人身上都濺滿了泥點。

sentences.english: The mud spatted all over my body.
A car ran past, spotting my coat with mud.
sentences.chinese: 一輛汽車駛過，給我的外衣濺上了泥點。

sentences.english: A big drop of water from the eaves had spattered the soup all over his face.
sentences.chinese: 一滴很大的檐水落在盆底，濺了他一臉菜湯。

sentences.english: Little rain drops falling from the rib of her umbrella splashed on my glasses.
sentences.chinese: 從她傘骨滑下來的小雨點濺在我眼鏡玻璃上。

sentences.english: Rolling down rain drops from her umbrella ribs splashed on my glasses.
sentences.chinese: 從她傘骨滑下來的小雨點濺在我眼鏡玻璃上。

sentences.english: The soup is spilt on my clothes.
sentences.chinese: 竟把湯水濺到我衣服上來了。

sentences.english: Use a blotter to take up the spilt ink.
sentences.chinese: 用一張吸墨紙把濺出來墨水吸掉。

sentences.english: Raindrops from her umbrella ribs spattered down on my glasses.
sentences.chinese: 從她傘骨滲下來的小雨點濺在我眼鏡玻璃上。

definition: to throw oneself at/to pounce on/to devote one's energies/to flap/to flutter/to dab/to pat/to bend over
to wash/to squander/to sweep away/to move/to shake/dissolute/pond
fine rain/drizzle/poem by Tang poet Li Shangyin 李商隱|李商隐
to turn over/to surge/to churn/to rummage/raging (torrent)
